title.narrative: (909.2) PROTECTION FROM DISASTERS

description.narrative: Children's rights to protection from disasters and in times of crisis - Emergency risks, including those associated with security, political, socio-economic and natural disaster events in the region are reduced, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral and Development Effectiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children?s rights to protection from disasters and in times of crisis - Emergency risks, including those associated with security, political, socio-economic and natural disaster events in the region are reduced

description.narrative: Strengthened preparedness/response capacity of countries to respond to COVID-19, refugee and migrant crisis,;Afghan Refugee influx in Central Asia and other emergencies. In-country/remote support provided to;develop preparedness and response plans, HAC appeals, situation reports and facilitated resource mobilization. WASH response strengthened with technical, resource mobilization support including improved IPC and;hand hygiene initiatives. Risk monitoring maintained and triggered preparedness actions. Risk informed programming advanced with orientation and;technical support. Strategic partnerships fostered with IFRC, CADRI, IBCs, CESDRR,;Sida and SweCEPA for air pollution,;WHO for WASH. Environment/climate study conducted to define strategies to integrate environment/climate in existing programmes.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/04/2022
